name: crispness
content:
crispness noun [U]
(OF FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of fruit or vegetables) the quality of being fresh, firm, and pleasant to eat: Celery loses its crispness when it is no longer good to eat. The broccoli was cooked to the right degree of crispness.
(of cooked foods such as pastry and biscuits) the quality of having been cooked well enough to be dry and hard in a pleasant way: The skins can be left on the potatoes for extra crispness. For maximum crispness, cook the pizza on a pizza stone.
More examplesFewer examplesHarvest lettuce in the morning to preserve the crispness it acquires overnight.He pulled back the husk of an ear of corn to test its crispness.The sausages lack crispness or sizzle.The top of the pie has an amazing crispness to it.

crispness noun [U]
(OF PAPER, CLOTH)
(of cloth or paper) the quality of being stiff and smooth: Damp clothes had dried to a crispness over a string line in the kitchen. The e-book's screen is designed to replicate the crispness of a paper page.
More examplesFewer examplesI knew he was an officer from the crispness of his uniform.He could feel the lacquered crispness of her hair on his ear.

crispness noun [U]
(OF IMAGE, SOUND)
(of an image or sound) the quality of being very clear: Two factors determine the crispness of the computer image. Her performance was memorable for the purity and crispness of her tone.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a crispness to details and a weight and solidity to objects in this video game.New audio technology gives music a crispness and clarity previously available only on vinyl LPs.The crispness of the picture was such that you could pick out every grain of rock on a New Mexico mountainside.

crispness noun [U]
(OF SPEECH, WRITING)
(of a way of speaking, writing, or behaving) the quality of being quick, confident, and effective: His writing lacks the crispness it once had. The storytelling loses its crispness in the final half-hour.
More examplesFewer examplesThis character's lines have to be delivered with absolute crispness.His personal observations, delivered with his customary crispness, are a joy to read.There was no desire in their play and no crispness to their passing.
